alType":"bytes","name":"","type":"bytes"},{"internalType":"bytes32","name":"","type":"bytes32"},{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"name":"beforeAllHook","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bytes","name":"_terms","type":"bytes"},{"internalType":"bytes","name":"_args","type":"bytes"},{"internalType":"ModeCode","name":"_mode","type":"bytes32"},{"internalType":"bytes","name":"_executionCallData","type":"bytes"},{"internalType":"bytes32","name":"_delegationHash","type":"bytes32"},{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"_redeemer","type":"address"}],"name":"beforeHook","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bytes","name":"_terms","type":"bytes"}],"name":"getAllTermsInfo","outputs":[{"internalType":"address[]","name":"tokens_","type":"address[]"},{"internalType":"uint256[]","name":"periodAmounts_","type":"uint256[]"},{"internalType":"uint256[]","name":"periodDurations_","type":"uint256[]"},{"internalType":"uint256[]","name":"startDates_","type":"uint256[]"}],"stateMutability":"pure","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bytes32","name":"_delegationHash","type":"bytes32"},{"internalType":"address","name":"_delegationManager","type":"address"},{"internalType":"bytes","name":"_terms","type":"bytes"},{"internalType":"bytes","name":"_args","type":"bytes"}],"name":"getAvailableAmount","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"availableAmount_","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"bool","name":"isNewPeriod_","type":"bool"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"currentPeriod_","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_caller","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"_token","type":"address"},{"internalType":"bytes32","name":"_delegationHash","type":"bytes32"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_index","type":"uint256"}],"name":"getHashKey","outputs":[{"internalType":"bytes32","name":"","type":"bytes32"}],"stateMutability":"pure","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bytes","name":"_terms","type":"bytes"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_tokenIndex","type":"uint256"}],"name":"getTermsInfo","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"token_","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"periodAmount_","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"periodDuration_","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"startDate_","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"pure","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bytes32","name":"hashKey","type":"bytes32"}],"name":"periodicAllowances","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"periodAmount","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"periodDuration","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"startDate","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"lastTransferPeriod","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"transferredInCurrentPeriod","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"details":"The enforcer expects the _terms to be a concatenation of one or more 116-byte configurations.      Each 116-byte segment encodes:        - 20 bytes: token address (address(0) indicates a native transfer)        - 32 bytes: periodAmount.        - 32 bytes: periodDuration (in seconds).        - 32 bytes: startDate for the first period.      Duplicate token entries in the terms are supported. Each configuration is identified      by its index, allowing the same token to have multiple distinct allowances.      The internal mapping includes the index in its hash key, enabling separate      tracking per configuration.      Additionally, the enforcer does not support restrictions on the recipient address or      arbitrary calldata. For ERC20 transfers, the execution data is strictly required to      match the IERC20.transfer function selector with a zero ETH value, and for native transfers,      only an empty calldata is permitted.      The _executionCallData always contains instructions for one token transfer.","events":{"TransferredInPeriod(address,address,bytes32,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"delegationHash":"The hash identifying the delegation.","periodAmount":"The maximum transferable amount per period.","periodDuration":"The duration of each period in seconds.","redeemer":"The address receiving the tokens/ETH.","sender":"The address initiating the transfer.","startDate":"The timestamp when the first period begins.","token":"The token contract address; for native transfers this is address(0).","transferTimestamp":"The block timestamp when the transfer occurred.","transferredInCurrentPeriod":"The total transferred in the current period after this afterAllHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,b.details: This function MUST revert if the conditions are not met.

params._args: An optional input parameter set by the redeemer at time of invocation.
params._mode: The mode of execution for the executionCalldata.
params._redeemer: The address that is redeeming the delegation.
params._terms: The terms to enforce set by the delegator.

afterHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,byte.details: This function MUST revert if the conditions are not met.

params._args: An optional input parameter set by the redeemer at time of invocation.
params._mode: The mode of execution for the executionCalldata.
params._redeemer: The address that is redeeming the delegation.
params._terms: The terms to enforce set by the delegator.

beforeAllHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,.details: This function MUST revert if the conditions are not met.

params._args: An optional input parameter set by the redeemer at time of invocation.
params._mode: The mode of execution for the executionCalldata.
params._redeemer: The address that is redeeming the delegation.
params._terms: The terms to enforce set by the delegator.

beforeHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,byt.details: For ERC20 transfers, expects _executionCallData to decode to (target,, callData)      with callData length of 68, beginning with IERC20.transfer.selector and zero value.      For native transfers, expects _executionCallData to decode to (target, value, callData)      with an empty callData.

params._args: A single uint256 value representing the index of the token configuration to use.
params._mode: The execution mode (must be single callType, default execType).
params._redeemer: The address intended to receive the tokens/ETH.
params._terms: A concatenation of one or more 116-byte configurations.

getAllTermsInfo(bytes).details: Expects _terms length to be a multiple of 116.

returns.periodDurations_: An array of period durations (in seconds).
returns.startDates_: An array of start dates for the first period.

params._args: A single uint256 value representing the index of the token configuration to use.
params._terms: A concatenation of one or more 116-byte configurations.

returns.availableAmount_: The remaining transferable amount in the current period.
returns.isNewPeriod_: True if a new period has begun.

params._caller: Address of the sender calling the enforcer.
params._token: Token being compared in the beforeHook and afterHook.

returns._0: The hash to be used as key of the mapping.

getTermsInfo(bytes,uint256).details: Expects _terms length to be a multiple of 116.

params._tokenIndex: The index of the token configuration to retrieve.

returns.periodAmount_: The maximum transferable amount for this token.
returns.periodDuration_: The period duration (in seconds) for this token.
returns.startDate_: The start date for the first period.
returns.token_: The token address at the specified index.

afterAllHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,b.notice: Enforces conditions after all actions in a batch redemption process have been executed.

afterHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,byte.notice: Enforces conditions after the execution tied to a specific delegation in the redemption process.

beforeAllHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,.notice: Enforces conditions before any actions in a batch redemption process begin.

beforeHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,byt.notice: Hook called before a transfer to enforce the periodic limit.

getAvailableAmount(bytes32,address,bytes.notice: Retrieves the available amount along with period details for a specific token.

getHashKey(address,address,bytes32,uint2.notice: Generates the key that identifies the run. Produced by the hash of the values used.

getTermsInfo(bytes,uint256).notice: Retrieves the configuration for a specific token index from _terms.
